intro: Correa lawrenciana var. typica, commonly known as the common correa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, particularly in New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract birds and butterflies.
